thread.title: Spurs transfer news: Danny Rose rejects £285,000-a-week deal from ex-Chelsea boss Andre Villas-Boas | Metro News
thread.title_full: Spurs transfer news: Danny Rose rejects £285,000-a-week deal from ex-Chelsea boss Andre Villas-Boas | Metro News

author: Metro Sport Reporter For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Spurs transfer news: Danny Rose rejects £285,000-a-week deal from ex-Chelsea boss Andre Villas-Boas | Metro News
text:
Danny Rose rejects £285,000-a-week deal from ex-Chelsea boss Andre Villas-Boas gossip Metro Sport Reporter for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 14 Feb 2017 11:09 pm Rose is set to stay at Tottenham (Picture: AMA/Getty) 
Danny Rose has turned down a staggering £285,000-a-week offer from Shanghai SIPG in order to stay with Tottenham Hotspur, according to reports. 
The England international was offered a whopping £14.5million-a-year deal from the Chinese Super League club, who are managed by former Chelsea and Spurs boss Andre Villas-Boas. 
But he decided to turn a move down as he looks to win a trophy under Mauricio Pochettino at White Hart Lane, according to The Sun. 
Rose is a big believer in his Argentine manager and has rejected a sensational amount of money to try and achieve success with Spurs.
